Rachel Greenwood and Engagement Through Big Topics (video)

When she first started teaching, Adult Education Instructor Rachel Greenwood thought students would find "fun, light-hearted" topics easier to engage with. However, as she continued to work with adult learners at a community center in Chicago, she realized that adult learners engage more with "deeper, more meaningful" topics. 

Many adult education teachers, like Rachel, report that using stories from the news to teach literacy skills is one of the most effective methods for engaging adult learners.
